name: Israeli Bagrut (Matriculation)
description: The Israeli Bagrut examination is the national high school certification exam in Israel. Students take exams in core and elective subjects at various unit levels (3, 4, or 5 units) with higher units indicating greater depth and difficulty. The Bagrut certificate is required for university admission.

3_units.name: 3 יחידות לימוד
3_units.description: Basic level, minimum requirement for most subjects

5_units.name: 5 יחידות לימוד
5_units.description: Advanced level, most comprehensive and challenging

assessmentPhilosophy: Bagrut exams emphasize demonstrating complete mastery of material through showing all work and reasoning. Partial credit is awarded for correct methodology even if the final answer is incorrect. Questions progress from straightforward recall to complex multi-step problems requiring integration of multiple concepts. All work must be shown clearly to receive full credit.

keyTerminology.יחידות לימוד: Study Units - measure of course depth (3, 4, or 5 units)
keyTerminology.מועד: Exam session (מועד א׳ - first session, מועד ב׳ - second session)
